1116010459411304448.text: Feelin' pretty fancy here at the second @zkproof event!  #ZKProofpic.twitter.com/ArjXY3CO0f

1113352709212647424.text:
The 2nd edition of the ZKproof Workshop is only a week away. The full programme and abstracts can be viewed here: https://zkproof.org/workshop2/abstracts.html …
@zkproof #zeroknowledge #zkSNARKs #privacytech

1108375183146934272.text: We’re looking forward to sponsoring and attending next month’s 2nd ZKProof Workshop in Berkeley (April 10-12th). Here’s a summary of the first workshop held last May: https://youtu.be/MeFwnRskalY  @zkproof #privacy

1105989444161531904.text:
On the heels of @zkproof's event, the @SimonsInstitute is holding ZK Day 2019 on Saturday, April 13, in Berkeley: https://simons.berkeley.edu/events/zero-knowledge-day-2019-registration …

Here's the program: https://simons.berkeley.edu/events/zero-knowledge-day-2019 …

1101150123827048449.text:
We're delighted to sponsor the 2nd ZKProof Workshop held at Berkeley this April. Don't hesitate to reach out if you'd like to meet! @zkproof
https://zkproof.org/workshop2/main.html …

1123209090396717057.text:
We just published the video recordings of the talks from the 2nd ZKProof Workshop:

https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLOEty2U8Y69VKX0THZvO_liqwV3Ngf1wt …

And here you can find the speaker's slides:

https://community.zkproof.org/t/zkproof-2019-speaker-slides/167/10 …

1123226385143742464.text: Thank you to all the speakers and to @AlexWinStudios for the great recordings!

1121545484504584193.text: More speakers have added their slides. Recordings of the talks will be published next week, keep an eye!https://twitter.com/ZcashFoundation/status/1121535885571284992 …

1120643707185897473.text: We have now doubled in size from the first workshop.pic.twitter.com/XtXAv3c8rP

1120643194214072320.text:
The 2nd #ZKProof Workshop was a success, with many important discussions taking place! See some of these in our http://community.zkproof.org  forum and join us in building the ZKProof Community Reference document.

Here is a teaser picture of the ZKProof Community, more to come soon!pic.twitter.com/iy3vS7uDMy

1116746775950270465.text: Alessandro Chiesa from @UCBerkeley, @StarkWareLtd and @zcashco, talking about IOP-based ZKPs. He asks the question: what kind of schemes will we use in 100 years to sustain public digital infrastructure?pic.twitter.com/3uWt6RftsA

1116454260361711616.text: The first panel discussion on Zero Knowledge in the Industry is starting now: Yael Kalai (@MSFTResearch,) Mike Hearn (@inside_r3), Carlos Kuchkovsky (@BBVAInnovation) and Jonathan Levi (@HACERA_INC), moderated by Jonathan Rouach (@qeditzkp)

1116393340394586113.text: Rene Peralta from @usnistgov talking about the Privacy Enhancing Cryptography group in the organization and the relevance of the #ZKProof Standards effort.pic.twitter.com/gvn5FaT2nU

1116045750163501056.text: We have a full room at the workshop on the first day! #ZKProofpic.twitter.com/oSyYGt4Mkr

1116013080234811393.text:
The 2nd ZKProof Standards Workshop has officially started. We are looking forward to all the talks and discussions on zero knowledge. 
We want to thank all of our sponsors again for helping make this workshop happen. #ZKProof

1115877244902289411.text:
The day is here, in the morning we start with the 2nd ZKProof Workshop.
The day will finish with
 @barrywhitehat from @ethereum on succinct proofs on Ethereum 
Nick Spooner from Berkeley, on Aurora, an R1CS & IOP based ZKPhttps://twitter.com/zkproof/status/1115374467310657546 …

1114986802652286977.text:
The two latest posts on our http://community.zkproof.org  forum 
- a deep dive into the FRI protocol of zkSTARKs https://community.zkproof.org/t/zkstarks-a-deep-dive-into-the-fri-protocol/119 …

- a question on using HSM tools for storing the private witness data of the proof generation https://community.zkproof.org/t/hsm-support-for-protecting-witness-values/116 …

Join the conversation!

1114903428143169538.text: You can also find some of the Community Standards discussions already in our community forum - http://community.zkproof.org https://twitter.com/sweis/status/1114742778297077761 …

1113200277883113472.text:
We have officially sold out for the 2nd ZKProof Workshop!
Thank you everyone who registered, we are looking forward to see you all next week.
For the agenda and absracts, see http://zkproof.org/workshop2/main.html#schedule …

1110194706095456256.text:
We are excited to see that a standard on zero-knowledge proofs is important to many in the industry.
We welcome two new sponsors for the coming workshop:
@VMware 
Ethereum Foundation @ethereum 

Thank you to all our sponsors!
http://zkproof.org/workshop2/main.html#sponsors …

1109789437150531584.text:
After the succesful ZK0x3 summit by @zeroknowledgefm last friday, we continue with the Zero Knowledge events. In less than 20 days we are in Berkeley for the 2nd #ZKProof Workshop. 

Find the agenda at http://zkproof.org/workshop2/main.html#schedule …

There are only a few spots left, so grab yours!

1107651704391168000.text: We want to remind everyone that the early-bird tiket sale for the 2nd ZKProof Workshop is ending tomorrow. Get your ticket now before it is too late!

1105181040593825793.text:
We just published our agenda for the second workshop.
The first day is packed with great talks, as we managed to fit everything in main stage.
Don't miss the standards days as the talks & discussions are oriented towards motivating and creating a standard.
http://ZKProof.org/workshop2/main.html#schedule …https://twitter.com/Avivz78/status/1105164183836999683 …

1105133497797226497.text:
Be on the look out for the full agenda in the coming days.

We still have available spots to attend the workshop - request your invite here http://zkproof.org/workshop2/registration.html …

Make sure to hurry since the early bird price is finishing on March 19th!https://twitter.com/zkproof/status/1105132518561464321 …

1105132518561464321.text:
We are excited to announce another great speaker:
Burt Kaliski, who used to be Chief Scientist at RSA Laboratories and worked on the PKCS standards, will be joining us at the #ZKProof workshop in April and will speak about the history of standardizing RSA and the lessons learned.

1102509396213620739.text:
One of the community standards proposals submitted for the upcoming workshop. 

Share yours on the community forum to start the discussion. http://community.zkproof.org https://twitter.com/qeditzkp/status/1102508865751580673 …

1101216158840221698.text: We want to thank once more all of our sponsors who are essential to pushing the effort forward. #ZKProof #standardshttps://twitter.com/ZcashFoundation/status/1101214158886981632 …

1101112453562286080.text: Please use the references for the Track proceedings as written inhttp://zkproof.org/documents.html

1101108945047949315.text:
We want to remind everyone that tomorrow, March 1st, is the deadline for submission of Community Standards proposals - http://zkproof.org/workshop2/standards_proposals.html …

Send your proposal to contact@zkproof.org

1100013541250289665.text:
Our community forum has ~100 users and great discussions.
These zero-knowledge events coming up, do not miss them!  https://community.zkproof.org/c/zkannouncements …
#ZKProof2 by @zkproof
#Zcon1 by @ZcashFoundation
#zkTLV by zkTLV Meetup
Post your next big event by in the #zkAnnouncements category.

1098139582724489216.text: Yuval Ishai, a member of our SC, talking at the @BIUCrypto winter school about modular approaches of building zero knowledge schemes. Here is the "zoo" of properties to consider. The second workshop will tackle some of these.pic.twitter.com/DPFxrez4Wb

1095743312579956736.text: We are pleased to announce another great invited speaker: Rene Peralta from @usnistgov who will share with us about how NIST works in the standards space, including work in privacy enhancing cryptography as related to zero-knowledge.

1094626260859437058.text:

We have established the Zero-Knowledge Community Forum on discourse. Check it out.

1062810055265918980.text:
We have just published the website of the 2nd #ZKProof Workshop 2019, which will take place in Berkeley, California, on April 10th to 12th, 2019. 
http://zkproof.org/workshop2/main.html …

In order to participate in the workshop, please fill up this form.
https://zkproof.org/workshop2/registration.html …

1062766782535139328.text: We are happy to welcome three new members to the Steering Committee: Alessandro Chiesa, Jens Groth and Yael Kalai. Their addition and contribution will have a positive effect on the #ZKProof Standardization effort.

1024641890157817856.text: The three documents of the ZKProof Standards Workshop have now been published - http://zkproof.org/documents.html  We want to thank all of the participants, the sponsors and the track chairs for their contributions.

1023566462185885697.text: We just published the notes from the #ZKProof workshop at #Zcon0, check them out:https://zkproof.org/zcon0.html

1011981531416580102.text:
Come see us at the workshop today at #Zcon0 where we will talk about:

- Session 1pm: overview and feedback of the three documents 
- Session 2pm: how can you trust zero-knowledge proof technology? And what are the difficulties in writing front-end libraries for ZK systems?

1011980691989549056.text:
We just published the first draft of the Applications Track document! https://zkproof.org/ZKProof%20Applications%20Draft%200.1.pdf …

This draft is a work in progress and we would appreciate the community's feedback on the content of the document and what should be the next steps for the standard.

1009127278872285185.text:
We will be presenting the results of the #ZKProof Standards Workshop at #Zcon0, join us to actively contribute to the standards and the ZKProof Community. 

You can also stay up-to-date by joining the ZKProof mailing list https://groups.google.com/a/zkproof.org/forum/?hl=en#!forum/zkproof-standards-community …

1009125751189360641.text:
Here are the pictures from the first #ZKProof Standardization Workshop! (click on the "Pictures" tab) https://zkproof.org/standards_meetings.html …

Also, join the ZKProof Community by subscribing to our mailing list https://groups.google.com/a/zkproof.org/forum/?hl=en#!forum/zkproof-standards-community …

995022806114062343.text:
Here are the faces of #ZKProof pioneers! 
Academic and industry leaders committed side by side to define common Zero-Knowledge Proof Standards.pic.twitter.com/zruflUNas5

995032230232772610.text:
Third Track : define shared rules to make the development of ZKP applications more accessible.
#ZKproofpic.twitter.com/Ty8ArCp13h

995030941864218624.text:
Second Track: create common rules to accelerate Zero-Knowledge Proofs implementations.
#ZKproofpic.twitter.com/oD0UysvxpR

995029664447025152.text:
First Track: create Standards to ensure security of Zero-Knowledge Proofs.
#ZKproofpic.twitter.com/kEEDD9uvUf

994644537090953217.text:
Jonathan Rouach, CEO of @qeditzkp , and Josh Cincinnati, Executive Director of @ZcashFoundation, opened the workshop !  Thanks Yuval Ishai of Technion for introducing Pr. Shafi Goldwasser, co-inventor of Zero-Knowledge Proof cryptography and 2012 Turing Award recipient. 
#ZKProofpic.twitter.com/e1WPL9Et53

993514281378500608.text:
We want to thank our sponsors for their contribution:

Platinum: @ZcashFoundation & @qeditzkp 

Gold: Check Point Institute for Information Security

Silver: @inside_r3 @StratumnHQ @UR_Ventures @VMware @ThunderToken & Danhua Capital

991973668367544320.text: The Steering Committee is made up by some of the best cryptographers and computer scientists of our time: Shafi Golwasser, Yuval Ishai, Hugo Krawczyk, Ran Canetti, Eran Tromer, Muthu Venkitasubramaniam, @ElaineRShi and @Avivz78

991971109196259328.text: We are happy to introduce the #ZKProof Standardization effort. An open industry and academic initiative to standardize the use of cryptographic Zero Knowledge Proofs. Check us out at http://zkproof.org  #zkp #nizk #zksnark
